nsRip2.name: nsRip2
nsRip2.contactinfo: Fred Baker Postal: Cisco Systems 519 Lado Drive Santa Barbara, California 93111 Tel: +1 805 681 0115 E-Mail: fbaker@cisco.com Postal: Gary Malkin Xylogics, Inc. 53 Third Avenue Burlington, MA 01803 Phone: (617) 272-8140 EMail: gmalkin@Xylogics.COM
nsRip2.description: The MIB module to describe the RIP2 Version 2 Protocol

RouteTag.name: RouteTag
RouteTag.description: the RouteTag type represents the contents of the Route Domain field in the packet header or route entry

nsRip2GlobalsTable.name: nsRip2GlobalsTable
nsRip2GlobalsTable.description: A list of RIP2 Globals per VR.

nsRip2GlobalRouteChanges.name: nsRip2GlobalRouteChanges
nsRip2GlobalRouteChanges.description: The number of route changes made to the IP Route Database by RIP. This does not include the refresh of a route's age.

nsRip2GlobalQueries.name: nsRip2GlobalQueries
nsRip2GlobalQueries.description: The number of responses sent to RIP queries from other systems.

nsRip2IfStatTable.name: nsRip2IfStatTable
nsRip2IfStatTable.description: A list of subnets which require separate status monitoring in RIP.

nsRip2IfStatEntry.name: nsRip2IfStatEntry
nsRip2IfStatEntry.description: A Single Routing Domain in a single Subnet.

nsRip2IfStatAddress.name: nsRip2IfStatAddress
nsRip2IfStatAddress.description: The IP Address of this system on the indicated subnet. For unnumbered interfaces, the value 0.0.0.N, where the least significant 24 bits (N) is the ifIndex for the IP Interface in network byte order.

nsRip2IfStatRcvBadPackets.name: nsRip2IfStatRcvBadPackets
nsRip2IfStatRcvBadPackets.description: The number of RIP response packets received by the RIP process which were subsequently discarded for any reason (e.g. a version 0 packet, or an unknown command type).

nsRip2IfStatRcvBadRoutes.name: nsRip2IfStatRcvBadRoutes
nsRip2IfStatRcvBadRoutes.description: The number of routes, in valid RIP packets, which were ignored for any reason (e.g. unknown address family, or invalid metric).

nsRip2IfStatSentUpdates.name: nsRip2IfStatSentUpdates
nsRip2IfStatSentUpdates.description: The number of triggered RIP updates actually sent on this interface. This explicitly does NOT include full updates sent containing new information.

nsRip2IfStatStatus.name: nsRip2IfStatStatus
nsRip2IfStatStatus.description: Writing invalid has the effect of deleting this interface.

nsRip2IfConfTable.name: nsRip2IfConfTable
nsRip2IfConfTable.description: A list of subnets which require separate configuration in RIP.

nsRip2IfConfEntry.name: nsRip2IfConfEntry
nsRip2IfConfEntry.description: A Single Routing Domain in a single Subnet.

nsRip2IfConfAddress.name: nsRip2IfConfAddress
nsRip2IfConfAddress.description: The IP Address of this system on the indicated subnet. For unnumbered interfaces, the value 0.0.0.N, where the least significant 24 bits (N) is the ifIndex for the IP Interface in network byte order.

nsRip2IfConfDomain.name: nsRip2IfConfDomain
nsRip2IfConfDomain.description: Value inserted into the Routing Domain field of all RIP packets sent on this interface.

nsRip2IfConfAuthType.name: nsRip2IfConfAuthType
nsRip2IfConfAuthType.description: The type of Authentication used on this interface.

nsRip2IfConfAuthKey.name: nsRip2IfConfAuthKey
nsRip2IfConfAuthKey.description: The value to be used as the Authentication Key whenever the corresponding instance of nsRip2IfConfAuthType has a value other than noAuthentication. A modification of the corresponding instance of nsRip2IfConfAuthType does not modify the nsRip2IfConfAuthKey value. If a string shorter than 16 octets is supplied, it will be left- justified and padded to 16 octets, on the right, with nulls (0x00). Reading this object always results in an OCTET STRING of length zero; authentication may not be bypassed by reading the MIB object.

nsRip2IfConfSend.name: nsRip2IfConfSend
nsRip2IfConfSend.description: What the router sends on this interface. ripVersion1 implies sending RIP updates compliant with RFC 1058. rip1Compatible implies broadcasting RIP-2 updates using RFC 1058 route subsumption rules. ripVersion2 implies multicasting RIP-2 updates. ripV1Demand indicates the use of Demand RIP on a WAN interface under RIP Version 1 rules. ripV2Demand indicates the use of Demand RIP on a WAN interface under Version 2 rules.

nsRip2IfConfReceive.name: nsRip2IfConfReceive
nsRip2IfConfReceive.description: This indicates which version of RIP updates are to be accepted. Note that rip2 and rip1OrRip2 implies reception of multicast packets.

nsRip2IfConfDefaultMetric.name: nsRip2IfConfDefaultMetric
nsRip2IfConfDefaultMetric.description: This variable indicates the metric that is to be used for the default route entry in RIP updates originated on this interface. A value of zero indicates that no default route should be originated; in this case, a default route via another router may be propagated.

nsRip2IfConfStatus.name: nsRip2IfConfStatus
nsRip2IfConfStatus.description: Writing invalid has the effect of deleting this interface.

nsRip2IfConfSrcAddress.name: nsRip2IfConfSrcAddress
nsRip2IfConfSrcAddress.description: The IP Address this system will use as a source address on this interface. If it is a numbered interface, this MUST be the same value as nsRip2IfConfAddress. On unnumbered interfaces, it must be the value of nsRip2IfConfAddress for some interface on the system.

nsRip2PeerEntry.name: nsRip2PeerEntry
nsRip2PeerEntry.description: Information regarding a single routing peer.

nsRip2PeerAddress.name: nsRip2PeerAddress
nsRip2PeerAddress.description: The IP Address that the peer is using as its source address. Note that on an unnumbered link, this may not be a member of any subnet on the system.

nsRip2PeerDomain.name: nsRip2PeerDomain
nsRip2PeerDomain.description: The value in the Routing Domain field in RIP packets received from the peer. As domain suuport is deprecated, this must be zero.

nsRip2PeerLastUpdate.name: nsRip2PeerLastUpdate
nsRip2PeerLastUpdate.description: The value of sysUpTime when the most recent RIP update was received from this system.

nsRip2PeerVersion.name: nsRip2PeerVersion
nsRip2PeerVersion.description: The RIP version number in the header of the last RIP packet received.

nsRip2PeerRcvBadPackets.name: nsRip2PeerRcvBadPackets
nsRip2PeerRcvBadPackets.description: The number of RIP response packets from this peer discarded as invalid.

nsRip2PeerRcvBadRoutes.name: nsRip2PeerRcvBadRoutes
nsRip2PeerRcvBadRoutes.description: The number of routes from this peer that were ignored because the entry format was invalid.
